wikipedia_page.main:
Derek Isles (born 14 October 1943) is a former English cricketer: a wicket-keeper who played a single first-class match, for Worcestershire against the Pakistanis at Worcester in 1967.
In the game against the Pakistanis, his most notable achievement was his second-innings stumping of opener and captain Hanif Mohammad. He also took one catch, and made 17 and 4; both innings were not out meaning that he does not have a career batting average.In the Minor Counties and Second XI Championships, Isles played for the seconds of no fewer than five counties between 1962 and 1968.
